award_title: Collaborative Research: Investigation of Deformation Mechanism Interactions during Ultra-Precision Machining of Single Crystals
subject: Ultra-precision machining + shareable simulation code
body:
Hi Professor Min,

I saw your NSF project on machining ceramics like sapphire and understanding how defects affect the process. What caught my attention is how much trial-and-error currently goes into optimizing these parameters—seems like the kind of work where sharing reproducible models and simulation code could save your colleagues a lot of time.

I'm building Ouro, a platform where researchers publish working tools—scripts, simulations, datasets—that others can reuse directly. Less recreating methods from papers, more actual science.

Would be curious if this resonates for your group.

Best,
